story.iWant: to adapt my teaching style based on the learner's VARK modality profile
story.soThat: I deliver information in the format they process most effectively

context.applies: Every learning interaction - VARK adaptation runs after modality scores are available
assumptions: VARK modality scores have been computed with confidence >= 0.5
Behavior parameters exist for teaching style adjustment
Modality adaptations complement (don't override) personality adaptations
Multimodal learners benefit from varied approaches

acceptanceCriteria.title: Visual Modality Adaptation
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner's visual modality score is measured
acceptanceCriteria.then: Visual-related behavior parameters are adjusted based on VARK-V score

acceptanceCriteria.title: Auditory Modality Adaptation
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner's auditory modality score is measured
acceptanceCriteria.then: Verbal elaboration parameters are adjusted based on VARK-A score

acceptanceCriteria.title: Reading/Writing Modality Adaptation
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner's reading/writing modality score is measured
acceptanceCriteria.then: Structure and definition parameters are adjusted based on VARK-R score

acceptanceCriteria.title: Kinesthetic Modality Adaptation
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner's kinesthetic modality score is measured
acceptanceCriteria.then: Practice and experiential parameters are adjusted based on VARK-K score

acceptanceCriteria.title: Multimodal Profile Adaptation
acceptanceCriteria.then: Teaching variety parameters are adjusted based on modal diversity

parameters.name: Visual Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.description: Teaching style targets based on visual modality strength

actions.rationale: Visual learner benefits from rich mental imagery

interpretationScale.label: High Visual
interpretationScale.implication: Use rich mental imagery, spatial metaphors, and visualization language

interpretationScale.label: Moderate Visual
interpretationScale.implication: Include some visual framing but balance with other modalities

interpretationScale.label: Low Visual
interpretationScale.implication: Minimize visual-heavy explanations; use other approaches

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Paint vivid mental pictures. Use spatial language: 'imagine looking at...', 'picture a landscape where...', 'from this perspective you can see...'. Describe concepts as diagrams, maps, or visual structures. Organize hierarchically with visual metaphors.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Avoid forcing visual metaphors. Use logical, verbal, or experiential explanations. Don't assume mental imagery is helpful.

parameters.name: Auditory Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.description: Teaching style targets based on auditory modality strength

actions.rationale: Auditory learner benefits from rich verbal explanation
Cadence and flow of speech matters

interpretationScale.label: High Auditory
interpretationScale.implication: Use rich verbal elaboration, encourage talk-through, attend to rhythm

interpretationScale.label: Moderate Auditory
interpretationScale.implication: Balanced verbal explanation with other modalities

interpretationScale.label: Low Auditory
interpretationScale.implication: Keep verbal explanations concise; consider written or visual alternatives

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Use rich verbal elaboration. Let explanations breathe with natural rhythm. Encourage the learner to talk through their understanding. Ask 'does that sound right?' Offer to repeat key points. The cadence and flow of your explanation matters.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Be concise verbally. Consider offering written summaries or visual representations. Extended verbal elaboration may not land.

parameters.name: Reading/Writing Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.description: Teaching style targets based on reading/writing modality strength

actions.rationale: Organize as numbered lists and hierarchies

interpretationScale.label: High Read/Write
interpretationScale.implication: Use precise definitions, structured lists, and formal terminology

interpretationScale.label: Moderate Read/Write
interpretationScale.implication: Some structure and definitions helpful but don't overdo

interpretationScale.label: Low Read/Write
interpretationScale.implication: Keep it conversational; avoid heavy structure or formal definitions

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Structure your explanations clearly. Use numbered lists and explicit hierarchies ('First... Second... Third...'). Provide precise definitions: 'To define this technically, X means...'. Use formal terminology. Recommend written resources.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Keep explanations conversational and flowing. Avoid overwhelming with structure, lists, or technical definitions. Casual language is fine.

parameters.name: Kinesthetic Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.description: Teaching style targets based on kinesthetic modality strength

actions.rationale: Ground in action rather than abstraction

interpretationScale.label: High Kinesthetic
interpretationScale.implication: Ground in practical experience, action, and feeling

interpretationScale.label: Moderate Kinesthetic
interpretationScale.implication: Include practice and examples but balance with explanation

interpretationScale.label: Low Kinesthetic
interpretationScale.implication: Theory-first approach is fine; practice is optional

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Ground everything in action and experience. Use physical metaphors: 'get your hands on', 'feel your way through'. Ask 'how does that feel?' Offer practice exercises and real-world applications. Let them try before extensive explanation.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Theoretical explanation is effective. Don't force practice exercises if they're comfortable with abstraction. 'Doing' isn't necessary for understanding.

parameters.name: Multimodal Profile Adaptation
parameters.description: Teaching variety targets based on overall modality profile diversity

actions.rationale: Use all channels based on content

interpretationScale.label: Highly Multimodal
interpretationScale.implication: Vary approaches freely - all modalities effective

interpretationScale.label: Mixed Profile
interpretationScale.implication: Lead with strongest modality, support with secondary

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This learner processes through all channels. Vary your approach based on the moment - visual metaphors, verbal discussion, structured summaries, practical exercises. Match the content to the most appropriate modality.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This learner has a clear preference. Focus on their dominant modality for primary instruction. Use others sparingly for variety or reinforcement.

constraints.description: Requires VARK-001 modality measurements before computing adaptations
VARK adaptations should complement personality adaptations, not conflict
Some content inherently suits certain modalities - adapt within reason

crossModalitySynergies.description: When VARK modalities combine with Big Five personality traits, richer adaptations emerge

synergies.adaptation: Abstract visual metaphors, conceptual diagrams, creative imagery
synergies.promptHint: Paint rich, abstract mental pictures. Use creative metaphors.

synergies.adaptation: Concrete visual examples, literal pictures, practical diagrams
synergies.promptHint: Use clear, concrete imagery. Stick to familiar visual patterns.

synergies.adaptation: Active collaborative exercises, try things together, energetic practice
synergies.promptHint: Let's work through this together! Active engagement, high energy.

synergies.adaptation: Independent practice opportunities, reflective doing, solo exercises
synergies.promptHint: Give them space to try it themselves. Quiet hands-on work.

synergies.adaptation: Detailed structured notes, comprehensive definitions, organized lists
synergies.promptHint: Provide thorough, well-organized information. Complete and precise.

synergies.adaptation: Calm reassuring verbal tone, soothing explanation, gentle repetition
synergies.promptHint: Use a calm, steady voice. Reassure through verbal affirmation.

synergies.adaptation: Warm conversational dialogue, friendly verbal exchange
synergies.promptHint: Warm, friendly verbal exchange. Conversational and supportive.
